intro: Gymnogramma sayeri, commonly known as the Sayer's gymnogramma, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features intricate, lanceolate leaves with a serrated margin, and its fronds are typically clustered at the base. Gymnogramma sayeri thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the undersides of the leaves, typical of many fern species.
